results.title: La Balance (S)
results.creator_credit: Bob Swaim, Films A2 and Les Film Ariane
results.brief_description: Heightened crime and increased prosititution in the streets of Paris, force the criminal investigation department to set up a special unit of police called the Territorial Brigades. Their only hope of penetrating the French Maffia is through a network of informers but the perfect informer is killed and another must be found from the pimps and prostitutes of the French underground. Voted the best film of the year in France at the time of its release, La Balance is a world of violence where only the tough survive. This version is dubbed in English.

results.title: The Little convict
results.creator_credit: Sandra Gross, Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: In old New South Wales a new batch of convicts arrives including the little convict, young Toby Nelson. Consigned to a Government farm they are subjected to the cruelty of their tyrannical overseers, Sergeant Billy Langden and Corporal Weazel Wesley, finally resulting in the death of the pickpocket, Old Dipper. Toby escapes and flees into the alien Australian bush where he is saved from death by the aboriginal boy Wahroonga. Together with another escapee, highwayman Jack Doolan, and Wahroonga’s animal friends, they launch a spectacular mission to rescue the blacksmith Big George and Toby’s sister Polly. With Rolf Harris as a storyteller and the magic of live action and animation, this wonderful Australian historical adventure comes joyously to life.

results.title: Murder she said
results.creator_credit: George Pollock, George H. Brown and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Based upon the novel “4.50 from Paddington” by Agatha Christie also published as “What Mrs McGillicuddy Saw!” Dozing in her seat as the train leaves Paddington Station, Miss Jane Marple awakens to witness a strangulation aboard a passing train. The police do not believe her but undaunted, Miss Marple takes a job as a domestic in an attempt to discover the truth. Starring Margaret Rutherford, Arthur Kennedy, Muriel Pavlow and James Robertson Justice.

results.title: Inherit the wind
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kramer and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Inspired by the famous “Monkey Trial” of 1925, when a school teacher in Tennessee stood accused of teaching Darwin’s theory of evolution, this outstanding courtroom drama embodies the century old debate between Evolutionists and Creationists. The tightly woven script is highlighted by the timeless performances of Spencer Tracy and Fredric March as the defense and prosecution attorneys, Gene Kelly as the cynical, progressive reporter and Dick York as the young teacher.

results.title: Lost horizon
results.brief_description: Based on the international best-seller by James Hilton, this Hollywood classic made ‘Shangri La’ a household word. Ronald Colman, one of the few stars to successfully make the transition from the silent era to “talkies”, stars as a British consul who, together with a planeload of American and English passengers, flees war-torn China only to be hijacked to Tibet where he is taken to a remote idyllic Utopian community in the Himalayas where he has been chosen to become the next High Lama.

results.title: The Player
results.creator_credit: Robert Altman, Nick Wechsler, Michael Tolkin, David Brown, Avenue Pictures and Spelling International
results.brief_description: A sharp critique of Hollywood greed and power, director Robert Altman hits nails on heads as this Faustian black comedy unfolds on the screen. This cynical story begins with Griffin Mill (Tim Robbins), a smarmy young studio executive who is being threatened by a disgruntled and previously rejected screenwriter. Griffin decides to take the law into his own hands and accidentally kills the writer. Will he get away with it? Whoopi Goldberg is hilarious as the unconventional detective investigating the murder, Greta Scacchi is strange and seductive as the dead writer’s girlfriend and Peter Gallagher is truly slimy as the rising young star executive. The film also includes cameo appearances from sixty-five of Hollywood’s biggest names.

results.title: Murder at the gallop
results.creator_credit: George Pollock, George H. Brown and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Based upon the novel “After the funeral” also published as “Funerals are fatal” by Agatha Christie. Mr Enderby, a wealthy and elderly man, dies unexpectedly and his not-so-bereaved relatives gather for the reading of the will. The speculation that he may have been murdered intensifies when another relative is slain, begging the question, “Who will be next?” Starring Margaret Rutherford, Robert Morley, Flora Robson and Stringer Davis.

results.title: The Nutcracker prince
results.creator_credit: Paul Schibli, Kevin Gillis and Lacewood Productions
results.brief_description: Featuring the voices of Megan Follows, Keifer Sutherland, Phyllis Diller and Peter O’Toole, and set to Tchaikovsky’s score, this is a story of magic, adventure and romance. When Clara finds a nutcracker in the form of a soldier boy under the Christmas tree, her uncle tells her the story of the Nutcracker Prince turned to wood by the evil Mousequeen. The young Prince can only reverse the spell by fighting the terrible Mouseking and winning the love of a beautiful maiden.

results.title: In cold blood
results.brief_description: Truman Capote’s account of the slaughter of a Kansas farming family by two violent drifters has been transformed into a chilling and brutal examination of the nature of violence by director Richard Brooks. The almost paradaisical black and white cinemtography seduces the viewer who is then confronted by the horrific reality of psychotic murder. “In Cold Blood”, as does Capote in his novel, refuses easy moralising, simple sociological explanations and resists turning the material into melodrama or conforming to the dictates of the gangster genre. Edited with sharp precision, this film shocked American viewers on its release by revealing the sadism and ugliness underneath the frontier myth of rural America. Music by Quincy Jones. Starring Robert Blake.

results.title: The Best years of our lives
results.creator_credit: William Wyler, Samuel Goldwyn and Samuel Goldwyn Productions
results.brief_description: Selected by the Library of Congress as one of the most important films of all time, this multi-Oscar winning classic recounts the problems faced by three veterans returning home after World War II, as they attempt to pick up the threads of their civilian lives. Fine performances by Fredric March, Dana Andrews and real-life amputee Harold Russell, and sensitive direction from William Wyler help to make “The Best years of our lives” an unforgettable film experience.
